intro: Ardisia purpurascens var. corymbifera, commonly known as the clustered ardisia, is a species native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves that are elliptical in shape and arranged alternately along the stems. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in cymes, giving it the "clustered" characteristic in its name. The fruit is a bright red, fleshy berry that matures in the fall and is an important food source for various wildlife species.
